tool.name: cmpress
tool.description: Prepare a covariance model database for cmscan
tool.command: mkdir -p ./cm_model && #if str($cm_opts.cm_opts_selector) == "db": ln -s '$cm_opts.database.fields.path' ./cm_model/ #else: ln -s '$cmfile' ./cm_model/ #end if && cmpress -F ./cm_model/* && cd ./cm_model/ && tar -cvf '$outfile' *.i1f *.i1i *.i1m *.i1p

param.name: cmfile
param.label: Covariance models file from the history.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Starting from a CM database <cmfile> in standard Infernal-1.1 format, construct binary compressed datafiles for cm- scan. The cmpress step is required for cmscan to work.
**Input format**
The <cmfile> must be have already been calibrated with cmcalibrate for cmpress to work.
**Output format**
For further questions please refere to the Infernal `Userguide <http://eddylab.org/infernal/Userguide.pdf>`_.
